intro: Besleria filipes f. latior, commonly known as the broad-leaved besleria, is a hybrid form of the genus Besleria, native to the tropical regions of South America. This plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or cream markings. It produces striking, showy inflorescences with small, tubular flowers arranged in clusters, typically in shades of red or orange. The plant thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant for its ornamental foliage and vibrant floral display.
